alert.note: Alert for Custer Co Plains; Pennington Co Plains; Southern Meade Co Plains; Sturgis, Piedmont Foot Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 12 at 4:34AM MST until December 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...POTENT WINTER STORM EARLY TUESDAY THROUGH MIDWEEK... .A strong winter storm will impact the region late tonight through Wednesday night, with heavy snow, wind, and mixed precipitation for much of northeast Wyoming and western South Dakota. Six inches or more of snow is expected in most areas, with a good portion of far northeast Wyoming and the western South Dakota plains having high potential for over a foot of snow. Favored areas of the northern Black Hills could receive over 2 feet of snow. In addition, strong northwest winds gusting 40 to over 50 mph at times on the plains, will support blizzard conditions at times. Further east toward south central South Dakota, there will be the potential for freezing rain and sleet with icing possible. Some uncertainty still remains at this time with respect to the track, duration, and intensity of the storm, which will impact snow amounts and winds. This is especially the case for the central and southern Black Hills area (including Rapid City, Custer, Newcastle, and Hermosa), where downslope drying could highly affect snow amounts. Listen to NOAA Weather Radio or your local media for the latest updates on this storm. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches, highest amounts generally over far eastern Meade and Pennington counties. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...The Custer County Plains, the Pennington County Plains, the Sturgis/Piedmont Foot Hills and the Southern Meade County Plains. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means the combination of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds will create dangerous whiteout conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Custer Co Plains; Pennington Co Plains; Southern Meade Co Plains; Sturgis, Piedmont Foot Hills
